description: in; in, on, at; with; through; among; when; in exchange for
and; and, also; but; so; then
like; like, as, similar to, according to, about
to; to, toward; for; in regard to; of, about
from; from, of; on account of; beside; above; than; since

description.strongs_def: father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
description.kjv_def: chief, (fore-) father(-less), [idiom] patrimony, principal. Compare names in 'Abi-'.

description.derivation: from the same as H24 (אָבִיב, ʼâbîyb);

description.strongs_def: properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
description.kjv_def: break, destroy(-uction), [phrase] not escape, fail, lose, (cause to, make) perish, spend, [idiom] and surely, take, be undone, [idiom] utterly, be void of, have no way to flee.

description.strongs_def: {properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)}

description.derivation: active of participle of H6 (אָבַד, ʼâbad);
from H6 (אָבַד, ʼâbad); Compare H10 (אֲבַדֹּה, ʼăbaddôh).
description.strongs_def: concrete, something lost; abstract, destruction, i.e. Hades

description.derivation: the same as H9 (אֲבֵדָה, ʼăbêdâh), miswritten for H11 (אֲבַדּוֹן, ʼăbaddôwn);

description.strongs_def: to breathe after, i.e. (figuratively) to be acquiescent
description.kjv_def: consent, rest content will, be willing.

description.derivation: from H14 (אָבָה, ʼâbâh) (in the sense of bending toward);
from H14 (אָבָה, ʼâbâh) (in the sense of desiring);
from an unused root (apparently meaning to turn);
from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H410 (אֵל, ʼêl); father (i.e. possessor) of God;
description.strongs_def: Abiel, the name of two Israelites

description.derivation: from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H622 (אָסַף, ʼâçaph); father of gathering (i.e. gatherer);
from an unused root (meaning to be tender);
description.strongs_def: green, i.e. a young ear of grain; hence, the name of the month Abib or Nisan
description.kjv_def: Abib, ear, green ears of corn (not maize).

description.derivation: from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H1391 (גִּבְעוֹן, Gibʻôwn); father (i.e. founder) of Gibon;
or shorter אֲבִיגַל; from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H1524 (גִּיל, gîyl); father (i.e. source) of joy;
description.strongs_def: Abigail or Abigal, the name of two Israelitesses

description.derivation: from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H1777 (דִּין, dîyn); father of judgment (i.e. judge);
from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H3045 (יָדַע, yâdaʻ); father of knowledge (i.e. knowing);
description.strongs_def: Abida, a son of Abraham by Keturah

description.derivation: or prolonged אֲבִיָּהוּ ; from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H3050 (יָהּ, Yâhh); father (i.e. worshipper) of Jah;
description.strongs_def: Abijah, the name of several Israelite men and two Israelitesses

description.derivation: from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H1931 (הוּא, hûwʼ); father (i.e. worshipper) of Him (i.e. God);
from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H1935 (הוֹד, hôwd); father (i.e. possessor) of renown;
description.strongs_def: Abihud, the name of two Israelites

description.derivation: or (more correctly) אֲבִיחַיִל ; from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H2428 (חַיִל, chayil); father (i.e. possessor) of might;
description.strongs_def: Abihail or Abichail, the name of three Israelites and two Israelitesses

description.derivation: from H44 (אֲבִיעֶזֶר, ʼĂbîyʻezer) with the article inserted; father of the Ezrite;
description.strongs_def: an Abiezrite or descendant of Abiezer

description.derivation: from H14 (אָבָה, ʼâbâh), in the sense of want (especially in feeling);

description.strongs_def: provocative of desire; the caper berry (from its stimulative taste)

description.derivation: from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H2898 (טוּב, ṭûwb); father of goodness (i.e. good);
from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H2919 (טַל, ṭal); father of dew (i.e. fresh);
description.strongs_def: Abital, a wife of King David

description.derivation: from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H3220 (יָם, yâm); father of (the) sea (i.e. seaman);
description.strongs_def: Abijam (or Abijah), a king of Judah

description.derivation: from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and an elsewhere unused (probably foreign) word; father of Mael (apparently some Arab tribe);
from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H4428 (מֶלֶךְ, melek); father of (the) king;
description.strongs_def: Abimelek, the name of two Philistine kings and of two Israelites

description.derivation: from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H5068 (נָדַב, nâdab); father of generosity (i.e. liberal);
description.strongs_def: Abinadab, the name of four Israelites

description.derivation: from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H5278 (נֹעַם, nôʻam); father of pleasantness (i.e. gracious);
from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H5829 (עֵזֶר, ʻêzer); father of help (i.e. helpful);
description.strongs_def: Abiezer, the name of two Israelites

description.derivation: from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and an unused root of uncertain derivation; probably, father of strength (i.e. valiant);

description.kjv_def: angel, bull, chiefest, mighty (one), stout(-hearted), strong (one), valiant.

description.derivation: from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H7311 (רוּם, rûwm); father of height (i.e. lofty);
description.strongs_def: Abiram, the name of two Israelites

description.derivation: from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H7686 (שָׁגָה, shâgâh); father of error (i.e. blundering);
from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H7771 (שׁוֹעַ, shôwaʻ); father of plenty (i.e. prosperous);
description.strongs_def: Abishua, the name of two Israelites

description.derivation: from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H7791 (שׁוּר, shûwr); father of (the) wall (i.e. perhaps mason);
or (shorter) אַבְשַׁי ; from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H7862 (שַׁי, shay); father of a gift (i.e. probably generous);
or (shortened) אַבְשָׁלוֹם ; from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H7965 (שָׁלוֹם, shâlôwm); father of peace (i.e. friendly);
description.strongs_def: Abshalom, a son of David; also (the fuller form) a later Israelite

description.derivation: contracted from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H3498 (יָתַר, yâthar); father of abundance (i.e. liberal);
from an unused root (meaning to be grassy);
description.kjv_def: plain. Compare also the proper names beginning with Abel-.

description.strongs_def: Abel, the name of two places in Palestine.

description.derivation: apparently from H56 (אָבַל, ʼâbal) through the idea of negation;
from H58 (אָבֵל, ʼâbêl) and H1004 (בַּיִת, bayith) and H4601 (מַעֲכָה, Maʻăkâh); meadow of Beth-Maakah;
description.strongs_def: Abel of Beth-maakah, a place in Palestine

description.derivation: from H58 (אָבֵל, ʼâbêl) and the plural of H7848 (שִׁטָּה, shiṭṭâh), with the article inserted; meadow of the acacias;
description.strongs_def: Abel hash-Shittim, a place in Palestine

description.derivation: from H58 (אָבֵל, ʼâbêl) and the plural of H3754 (כֶּרֶם, kerem); meadow of vineyards;
from H58 (אָבֵל, ʼâbêl) and H4246 (מְחֹלָה, mᵉchôlâh)xlit mᵉchôwlâh corrected to mᵉchôlâh; meadow of dancing;
from H58 (אָבֵל, ʼâbêl) and H4325 (מַיִם, mayim); meadow of water;
from H58 (אָבֵל, ʼâbêl) and H4714 (מִצְרַיִם, Mitsrayim); meadow of Egypt;
from the root of H1129 (בָּנָה, bânâh) through the meaning to build;
description.kjv_def: [phrase] carbuncle, [phrase] mason, [phrase] plummet, (chalk-, hail-, head-, sling-) stone(-ny), (divers) weight(-s).

description.derivation: from the same as H68 (אֶבֶן, ʼeben);
description.strongs_def: a pair of stones (only dual); a potter's wheel or a midwife's stool (consisting alike of two horizontal disks with a support between)

description.derivation: perhaps feminine of H68 (אֶבֶן, ʼeben); stony;  Compare H549 (אֲמָנָה, ʼămânâh).
from H68 (אֶבֶן, ʼeben) and H5828 (עֵזֶר, ʻêzer) with the article inserted; stone of the help;
or (fully) אֲבִינֵר ; from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and H5216 (נִיר, nîyr); father of light (i.e. enlightening);
(by reduplication) from an unused root (meaning to belch forth);
from an unused root probably meaning to gleam; conspicuous;
from the same as H76 (אֲבַעְבֻּעָה, ʼăbaʻbuʻâh); splendid;
a primitive root, probably to float away (as vapor), but used only as denominative from H80 (אָבָק, ʼâbâq);
contracted from H1 (אָב, ʼâb) and an unused root (probably meaning to be populous); father of a multitude;
description.strongs_def: Abraham, the later name of Abram

description.derivation: contracted from H48 (אֲבִירָם, ʼĂbîyrâm); high father;
description.strongs_def: Abram, the original name of Abraham
Oboth, a place in the Desert

description.derivation: or אֲגָג; of uncertain derivation (compare H89 (אָגֵא, ʼÂgêʼ)); flame;
description.strongs_def: Agag, a title of Amalekitish kings

description.derivation: patrial or patronymic from H90 (אֲגַג, ʼĂgag);
description.strongs_def: an Agagite or descendent (subject) of Agag

description.derivation: feminine passive participle of an unused root (meaning to bind);
description.strongs_def: a band, bundle, knot, or arch

description.derivation: passive participle of H103 (אָגַר, ʼâgar); gathered (i.e. received among the sages);
description.strongs_def: Agur, a fanciful name for Solomon

description.derivation: from the same as H94 (אָגוּר, ʼÂgûwr);
description.strongs_def: properly, something gathered, i.e. perhaps a grain or berry; used only of a small (silver) coin

description.derivation: from an unused root (meaning to flow down or together as drops);
dual of H96 (אֶגֶל, ʼegel).; a double pond;
from an unused root (meaning to collect as water);
description.strongs_def: a marsh; hence a rush (as growing in swamps); hence a stockade of reeds

description.derivation: probably from the same as H98 (אֲגַם, ʼăgam) (in the sense of stagnant water);
from the same as H98 (אֲגַם, ʼăgam); a marshy pool (others from a different root, a kettle); by implication
description.strongs_def: a bulrush (as growing there); collectively a rope of bulrushes

description.derivation: probably from H5062 (נָגַף, nâgaph) (through the idea of impending); a cover or heap; i.e.
description.strongs_def: (only plural) wings of an army, or crowds of troops
an epistle (as carried by a state courier or postman)

description.derivation: from H1640 (גָּרַף, gâraph) (in the sense of grasping);
from the same as H181 (אוּד, ʼûwd) (in the sense of enveloping);
probably from H109 (אָדַב, ʼâdab) (in the sense of chastisement) and H410 (אֵל, ʼêl); disciplined of God;
probably an orthographical variation for H2301 (חֲדַד, Chădad);
or (shortened) אָדֹן; from an unused root (meaning to rule);
description.kjv_def: lord, master, owner. Compare also names beginning with 'Adoni-'.

description.derivation: probably intensive for H113 (אָדוֹן, ʼâdôwn); powerful;
dual from H142 (אָדַר, ʼâdar) (in the sense of eminence); double mound;

description.kjv_def: excellent, famous, gallant, glorious, goodly, lordly, mighty(-ier one), noble, principal, worthy.

description.derivation: to show blood (in the face), i.e.

description.strongs_def: ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
description.kjv_def: [idiom] another, [phrase] hypocrite, [phrase] common sort, [idiom] low, man (mean, of low degree), person.

description.strongs_def: Adam the name of the first man, also of a place in Palestine

description.derivation: or (fully) אֱדוֹם ; from H122 (אָדֹם, ʼâdôm); red (see Genesis 25:25);
description.strongs_def: Edom, the elder twin-brother of Jacob; hence the region (Idumaea) occupied by him
redness, i.e. the ruby, garnet, or some other red gem
Admah, a place near the Dead Sea

description.derivation: or (fully) אֱדוֹמִי ; patronymic from H123 (אֱדֹם, ʼĔdôm); See H726 (אֲרוֹמִי, ʼĂrôwmîy).
description.strongs_def: an Edomite, or descendants from (or inhabitants of) Edom

description.derivation: plural of H121 (אָדָם, ʼâdâm); red spots;

description.strongs_def: reddish (of the hair or the complexion)

description.derivation: from the same as H113 (אָדוֹן, ʼâdôwn) (in the sense of strength);
description.strongs_def: a basis (of a building, a column, etc.)

description.derivation: intensive from the same as H134 (אֶדֶן, ʼeden); firm;
an emphatic form of H113 (אָדוֹן, ʼâdôwn);
description.strongs_def: the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)

description.derivation: from H113 (אָדוֹן, ʼâdôwn) and H966 (בֶּזֶק, Bezeq); lord of Bezek;
original (prolonged) אֲדֹנִיָּהוּ ; from H113 (אָדוֹן, ʼâdôwn) and H3050 (יָהּ, Yâhh); lord (i.e. worshipper) of Jah;
description.strongs_def: Adonijah, the name of three Israelites

description.derivation: from H113 (אָדוֹן, ʼâdôwn) and H6664 (צֶדֶק, tsedeq); lord of justice;
from H113 (אָדוֹן, ʼâdôwn) and H6965 (קוּם, qûwm); lord of rising (i.e. high);
description.strongs_def: Adonikam, the name of one or two Israelites

description.derivation: from H113 (אָדוֹן, ʼâdôwn) and H7311 (רוּם, rûwm); lord of height;

description.strongs_def: to expand, i.e. be great or (figuratively) magnificent

description.derivation: probably of foreign derivation; perhaps meaning fire;

description.strongs_def: amplitude, i.e. (concrete) a mantle; also (figuratively) splendor
Addar, a place in Palestine; also an Israelite

description.derivation: (Aramaic) intensive, from a root corresponding to H142 (אָדַר, ʼâdar);
(Aramaic) from the same as H147 (אִדַּר, ʼiddar), and H1505 (גְּזַר, gᵉzar);
from H142 (אָדַר, ʼâdar) and H4428 (מֶלֶךְ, melek); splendor of (the) king;
description.strongs_def: Adrammelek, the name of an Assyrian idol, also of a son of Sennacherib

description.derivation: (Aramaic) an orthographical variation for H1872 (דְּרַע, dᵉraʻ);
from the equivalent of H153 (אֶדְרָע, ʼedrâʻ); mighty;
description.strongs_def: Edrei, the name of two places in Palestine

description.derivation: feminine of H117 (אַדִּיר, ʼaddîyr); ; also the same as H145 (אֶדֶר, ʼeder)
description.strongs_def: something ample (as a large vine, a wide dress)
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
affection (in a good or a bad sense)

description.derivation: from H156 (אָדַשׁ, ʼâdash); meaning the same as H158 (אַהַב, ʼahab)
description.strongs_def: {affection (in a good or a bad sense)}

description.derivation: feminine of H158 (אַהַב, ʼahab) and meaning the same
description.strongs_def: {affection (in a good or a bad sense)}

description.derivation: from an unused root meaning to be united; unity;
apparently a primitive word expressing pain exclamatorily;
from the same as H161 (אֹהַד, ʼÔhad); united;
description.strongs_def: Ehud, the name of two or three Israelites

description.derivation: apparently an orthographical variation for H346 (אַיֵּה, ʼayêh);
description.kjv_def: I will be (Hosea 13:10,14) (which is often the rendering of the same Hebrew form from H1961 (הָיָה)).

description.strongs_def: a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)

description.derivation: in form a feminine of H168 (אֹהֶל, ʼôhel), but in fact for אׇהֳלָהּ; from H168 (אֹהֶל, ʼôhel); her tent (i.e. idolatrous sanctuary);
description.strongs_def: Oholah, a symbolic name for Samaria

description.derivation: from H168 (אֹהֶל, ʼôhel) and H1 (אָב, ʼâb); tent of (his) father;
(similarly with H170 (אׇהֳלָה, ʼOhŏlâh)) for אׇהֳלִיבָהּ ; from H168 (אֹהֶל, ʼôhel); my tent (is) in her;
description.strongs_def: Oholibah, a symbolic name for Judah

description.derivation: from H168 (אֹהֶל, ʼôhel) and H1116 (בָּמָה, bâmâh); tent of (the) height;
or (feminine) אֲהָלוֹת (only used thus in the plural); of foreign origin;
presumed to be the 'constructive' or genitival form of אַו ; short for H185 (אַוָּה, ʼavvâh);
description.strongs_def: desire (and so probably in Proverbs 31:4); hence (by way of alternative) or, also if
description.kjv_def: also, and, either, if, at the least, [idiom] nor, or, otherwise, then, whether.

description.derivation: from H176 (אוֹ, ʼôw) and H410 (אֵל, ʼêl); wish of God;
from the same as H1 (אָב, ʼâb) (apparently through the idea of prattling a father's name);
description.strongs_def: properly, a mumble, i.e. a water skin (from its hollow sound); hence a necromancer (ventriloquist, as from a jar)

description.derivation: or (shortened) אֻבָל ; from H2986 (יָבַל, yâbal) (in the sense of H2988 (יָבָל, yâbâl));
from an unused root meaning to rake together;
description.strongs_def: a poker (for turning or gathering embers)

description.derivation: or (shortened) אֹדוֹת (only thus in the plural); from the same as H181 (אוּד, ʼûwd);

description.kjv_def: covet, (greatly) desire, be desirous, long, lust (after).

description.derivation: perhaps by permutation for H5813 (עֻזִּי, ʻUzzîy), strong;
probably from H183 (אָוָה, ʼâvâh) (in the sense of crying out after);
from an unused root (meaning to be perverse);
of Aramaic derivation and probably meaning soldier of Merodak;
from an unused root meaning to twist, i.e. (by implication) be strong;
description.strongs_def: the body (as being rolled together); also powerful

description.kjv_def: if so be, may be, peradventure, unless.

description.strongs_def: the Ulai (or Eulaeus), a river of Persia

description.derivation: or (shortened), אֻלָם ; from H481 (אָלַם, ʼâlam) (in the sense of tying);
description.strongs_def: a vestibule (as bound to the building)

description.derivation: appar, from H481 (אָלַם, ʼâlam) (in the sense of dumbness); solitary;
description.strongs_def: Ulam, the name of two Israelites

description.derivation: apparently a variation of H194 (אוּלַי, ʼûwlay);
description.kjv_def: as for, but, howbeit, in very deed, surely, truly, wherefore.

description.derivation: from the same as H191 (אֱוִיל, ʼĕvîyl);
probably from the same as H205 (אָוֶן, ʼâven) (in the sense of effort, but successful);
from an unused root perhaps meaning properly, to pant (hence, to exert oneself, usually in vain; to come to naught);
description.strongs_def: strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
description.kjv_def: affliction, evil, false, idol, iniquity, mischief, mourners(-ing), naught, sorrow, unjust, unrighteous, vain, vanity, wicked(-ness). Compare H369 (אַיִן).

description.derivation: the same as H205 (אָוֶן, ʼâven); idolatry;
description.strongs_def: Aven, the contemptuous synonym of three places, one in Coele-Syria, one in Egypt (On), and one in Palestine (Bethel)
description.kjv_def: Aven. See also H204 (אוֹן), H1007 (בֵּית אָוֶן).

description.derivation: or (shortened) אֹנוֹ; prolonged from H202 (אוֹן, ʼôwn); strong;
a variation of H209 (אוֹנָן, ʼÔwnân); strong;
description.strongs_def: Onam, the name of an Edomite and of an Israelite

description.derivation: a variation of H207 (אוֹנוֹ, ʼÔwnôw); strong;
perhaps a corruption of H211 (אוֹפִיר, ʼÔwphîyr);
or (shortened) אֹפִיר; and אוֹפִר; of uncertain derivation;
description.strongs_def: Ophir, the name of a son of Joktan, and of a gold region in the East

description.derivation: or (shortened) אֹפָן; from an unused root meaning to revolve;

description.strongs_def: to press; (by implication) to be close, hurry, withdraw
to be (causative, make) luminous (literally and metaphorically)
description.kjv_def: [idiom] break of day, glorious, kindle, (be, en-, give, show) light (-en, -ened), set on fire, shine.

description.strongs_def: illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
description.kjv_def: bright, clear, [phrase] day, light (-ning), morning, sun.

description.strongs_def: flame; hence (in the plural) the East (as being the region of light)
Ur, a place in Chaldaea; also an Israelite
luminousness, i.e. (figuratively) prosperity; also a plant (as being bright)
Uri, the name of three Israelites

description.derivation: from H217 (אוּר, ʼûwr) and H410 (אֵל, ʼêl); flame of God;
description.strongs_def: Uriel, the name of two Israelites

description.derivation: or (prolonged) אוּרִיָּהוּ ; from H217 (אוּר, ʼûwr) and H3050 (יָהּ, Yâhh); flame of Jah;
description.strongs_def: Urijah, the name of one Hittite and five Israelites
Urim, the oracular brilliancy of the figures in the high-priest's breastplate
properly, to come, i.e. (implied) to assent

description.derivation: probably from H225 (אוּת, ʼûwth) (in the sense of appearing);
description.strongs_def: a signal (literally or figuratively), as aflag, beacon, monument, omen, prodigy, evidence, etc.
at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
description.kjv_def: beginning, for, from, hitherto, now, of old, once, since, then, at which time, yet.
